label: A4B2C3_oP18_59_ef_ab_ae-001
title: NH$_{4}$NO$_{3}$ IV ($G0_{11}$) Structure
comments:
Ammonium Nitrate exists in a variety of forms, (Hermann, 1937) depending on the temperature: \begin{tabular}{ccccc} \\ Phase & Temperature $^{\circ}$C & {\em Strukturbericht} & Page & \\ \hline I & 125 -- 170 & $G0_{8}$ & \href{current_web_home_dir/AB_cP2_221_a_b-001}{AB\_cP2\_221\_a\_b-001} \\ II & 84 -- 125 & $G0_{9}$ & \href{current_web_home_dir/ABC3_tP10_100_b_a_bc-001}{ABC3\_tP10\_100\_b\_a\_bc} \\ III & 32 -- 84 & $G0_{10}$ & \href{current_web_home_dir/ABC3_oP20_62_c_c_cd-002}{ABC3\_oP20\_62\_c\_c\_cd-002} \\ IV & -18 -- 32 & $G0_{11}$ & \href{current_web_home_dir/A4B2C3_oP18_59_ef_ab_ae-001}{A4B2C3\_oP18\_59\_ef\_ab\_af-001} & (this structure) \\ V & $< -18$ & & \href{current_web_home_dir/A4B2C3_tP72_77_8d_ab2c2d_6d-001}{A4B2C3\_tP72\_77\_8d\_ab2c2d\_6d2-001} \end{tabular} 
 In the original reference (West, 1932) did not determine the positions of the hydrogen atoms. (Choi, 1972) found the hydrogen atoms, and found that they did not change the space group. We therefore use their structure as the prototype for $G0_{11}$.
